cyclone.name: IAN
cyclone.current_location: about 615 miles ESE of Kingston, Jamaica
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to track westward, then west-northwest and northwest across the north-western Caribbean toward the Florida Peninsula early next week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Peninsula (most likely the west-central coast near Tampa Bay area)

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Florida Peninsula and portions of the Southeast U.S. coast, including northeast Florida
weather_observation.wind: Low (10%) chance of tropical-storm-force winds (34 kt) reaching the port late next week; 50-kt winds only 3% probability
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge possible if the center exits near the Atlantic coast (generally <3 ft)
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rainbands could bring several inches of rain with localized flooding late Wedâ€“Thu
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous seas, high surf and rip currents likely to impact vessel operations along the northeast Florida coast ahead of the system
